cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 105 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to resume WNW then turn NW–NE)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift WNW overnight, turn northwest Tuesday, then curve northeast Wednesday night and move parallel to the Southeast U.S. coastline before accelerating northeastward well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible close coastal pass or brush near the South or North Carolina coastline (no direct landfall forecast for New Jersey)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical Storm watches extend from north of Deerfield Beach FL to South Santee River SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge warnings from Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast through the Georgia and Carolina coasts; Mid-Atlantic coast (including New Jersey) mainly affected by peripheral winds and surf late week.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into Saturday; occasional gusts possible, mainly along the immediate Jersey shore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; water rise confined well south of New Jersey.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of light to moderate rain possible; totals generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey coastline beginning late Thursday and persisting through Saturday.
